byline.original: By THE DALAI LAMA and ARTHUR C. BROOKS

abstract: Op-Ed article by Dalai Lama and Arthur C Brooks notes irony that generally improved living conditions throughout much of globe have coincided with increased political frustration and anxiety among some of world's richest nations; blames malaise on people's increasing feelings of uselessness and calls on leaders to foster more compassionate societies that offer good education and meaningful work.

headline.print_headline: Under Our Anger, Fear of Being Unneeded
headline.main: Dalai Lama: Behind Our Anxiety, the Fear of Being Unneeded

snippet: There has never been a better time to be alive, and yet in the richest countries, there is a growing sense of unease and helplessness because people no longer feel useful....
lead_paragraph: There has never been a better time to be alive, and yet in the richest countries, there is a growing sense of unease and helplessness because people no longer feel useful.
